XRCylinderLayer.summary: NOTE Experimental The XRCylinderLayer interface of the WebXR Device API is a layer that takes up a curved rectangular space in the virtual environment. Only the front of the layer is visible.

XRCylinderLayerTransform.summary: NOTE Experimental The transform property of the interface represents the offset and orientation relative to the layer's .

XRCylinderLayerSpace.summary: NOTE Experimental The space property of the interface represents the layer's spatial relationship with the user's physical environment.

XRCylinderLayerCentralAngle.summary: NOTE Experimental The centralAngle property of the interface represents the angle in radians of the visible section of the cylinder.
XRCylinderLayerCentralAngle.value: A number representing the angle in radians of the visible section of the cylinder.

XRCylinderLayerRadius.summary: NOTE Experimental The radius property of the interface represents the radius of the cylinder.
XRCylinderLayerRadius.value: A number representing the radius of the cylinder.

XRCylinderLayerAspectRatio.summary: NOTE Experimental The aspectRatio property of the interface represents the ratio of the visible cylinder section. It is the ratio of the width of the visible section of the cylinder divided by its height. The width is calculated by multiplying the with the .
XRCylinderLayerAspectRatio.value: A number representing the ratio of the visible cylinder section.

XRCylinderLayerRedraw.summary: NOTE Experimental The redraw event is sent to the XRCylinderLayer object when the underlying resources of the layer are lost or when the XR Compositor can no longer reproject the layer. If this event is sent, authors should redraw the content of the layer in the next XR animation frame.
